definition: as empty as anything (idiom); completely bereft/to have nothing/vacuous/hollow/empty (argument, head etc)
petty thief (lit. quick fingered and vanish)/empty-handed/having nothing

sentences.english: The room is now completely bare.
sentences.chinese: 現在，整間屋子就空空如也了。

sentences.english: Empty is the White Horse Temple tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今夜的白馬寺空空蕩蕩。

sentences.english: The paper discusses the technology of long-range air-to-air missile attacking by two cooperative fighters.
sentences.chinese: 探討了雙機合作條件下遠程空空導彈的攻擊技術。

sentences.english: Finally, the new development features of air-to-air missiles in 2009 are summarized.
sentences.chinese: 最後，總結了2009年空空導彈研製出現的新特點。

sentences.english: Ann holds the empty basketry. Her hand is still wet.
sentences.chinese: 而安兩手溼溼地抱着空空的籃子。

sentences.english: She felt sad that she was coming home empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 她感到難過，她回家兩手空空。

sentences.english: This is going to be true for both future air-to-air and air-to-ground weapons.
sentences.chinese: 對於未來的空空和空地武器來說將會成爲現實。

sentences.english: All of a sudden it will feel as though your days are almost empty.
sentences.chinese: 某一刻你會忽然感到好像你的每一天都幾乎是空空的。

sentences.english: And authorities doubt they are coming home empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 當局懷疑他們回家兩手空空。

sentences.english: A generation ago, Chinese people had empty pockets in their dreary boiler suits.
sentences.chinese: 上一代人以前，中國人穿的單調的長衫口袋空空。

sentences.english: I glanced at the empty water bowl.
sentences.chinese: 我看了一眼空空的水碗。

sentences.english: Eventually their rooms would be almost empty.
sentences.chinese: 最終，他們的房間幾乎空空如也。

sentences.english: Hell is empty, And all the devils are here.
sentences.chinese: 地獄空空如也，而所有的惡魔妖魅皆在此。

sentences.english: The airport was like a ghost town, the terminal was empty and eerily silent.
sentences.chinese: 機場像座鬼城，候機大樓空空蕩蕩，寂靜得可怕。

sentences.english: Of the survivors, most have little left but their stories.
sentences.chinese: 大部分倖存者手中空空，惟有愁緒重重。

sentences.english: Pessimists note that one home in nine is still empty.
sentences.chinese: 悲觀主義者注意到，房子九中有一還是空空如也。

definition: as empty as anything (idiom); completely bereft/to have nothing/vacuous/hollow/empty (argument, head etc)
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
to stuff full/to cram in/packed tight/chock full
